Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: காக்க பொருளா அடக்கத்தை ஆக்கம்அதனினூஉங் கில்லை உயிர்க்கு.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Let self-control be guarded as a treasure; there is no greater source of good for man than that.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A person is shown carefully placing the concept of 'Self-Control' ('அடக்கம்') into a magnificent, glowing treasure chest.
Layered_Composition.Midground: Self-control is visualized not as an abstract idea, but as a beautiful, perfectly formed, radiant pearl. The person is guarding this pearl-treasure with utmost care ('காக்க பொருளா').
Layered_Composition.Background: All other forms of wealth and gain ('ஆக்கம்')—gold, crowns, land—are shown outside the treasure chest, depicted as lesser, dimmer objects. The image makes it clear that the pearl of self-control is the greatest treasure a soul can possess.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: Self-control should be guarded like the most precious treasure, because there is no greater wealth or source of good for a person's life.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The pearl of self-control is the central metaphor. Its perfect form and radiant light represent its supreme value. Placing it in a treasure chest reinforces the idea of guarding it as a possession of immense worth.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The primary light source is the radiant pearl of self-control, which casts a pure, white-gold light on the person's face and hands. The other treasures in the background have a dull, mundane sheen by comparison.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A close-up shot focusing on the hands carefully placing the glowing pearl into the treasure chest.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, with a strong focus on the beautiful, magical luminescence of the pearl.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Soft, radiant lighting emanating from the pearl.
Technical_Cues.Art_Genre: Symbolic still life, with magical realism.

Cultural_Anchors: Guard self-control as a treasure (காக்க பொருளா அடக்கத்தை)
